availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel Woodson Price (Lexington, Kentucky, artist and U.S. Army brigadier general)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, artist and soldier. Nicholasville, Kentucky native. Son of Daniel Branch Price and Elizabeth Crockett Price. Married to Mary Frances Thompson Price in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on May 26, 1853. Father of Sallie T. Price, M. B. Price, and Robert Price. Artist in Lexington in 1850. Portrait painter in Lexington in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Lexington in 1860. Served in the 21st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel from October 31, 1861, to December 9, 1865. Brevetted brigadier general on March 13, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, District 2, p. 203B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, 3rd Ward, p. 559.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, District 1, p. 456B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, p. 218A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000819597, p. 256.
Missouri, U.S., St. Louis Public Library Obituary Index, 1880-2011, St. Louis Public Library, St. Louis, Missouri, File #2792 (accessed via https://s1.sos.mo.gov/records/Archives/ArchivesMvc/DeathCertificates).
